pullrequest.title: Fix assertion failure on argument parsing when loading fasta sequence

content.raw:
I confirmed that seqfile_type is being set to `None` by default. The `default` argument in for each add_argument is presumed to be `None`. It could be the case that when the arguments get parsed (parse_args), they do not get parsed in the order they are added. This load sequence bug could be a bug from all the way on revision 0b39771b07e1 since this interface is not commonly used.

Thanks for the catch!
content.html:
I confirmed that seqfile_type is being set to None by default. The default argument in for each add_argument is presumed to be None. It could be the case that when the arguments get parsed (parse_args), they do not get parsed in the order they are added. This load sequence bug could be a bug from all the way on revision 0b39771b07e1 since this interface is not commonly used.

Thanks for the catch!
